719486f-a.text:
154-156 (6-stories), and 158 (4-stories) East Houston Street, north side, west from First Ave., as seen from Eldridge Street. These houses constitute part of the entire block of buildings which were rased to facilitate the construction of the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. Subway), and upon whose site was later built a playground.
July 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

719493f-a.text:
(1)
186 (left, partly shown) to 194 East Houston Street, north side, east of First Ave., as seen from Orchard Street. These houses constitute part of an entire block of such buildings which were razed to make way for the construction of the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. Subway). Note the market scene which is typical of this area often
referred to as the "Jewish Ghetto."
July 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A closer view of Nos. 190 and 192 East Houston Street, north side, at the foot of Orchard Street, showing the store fronts of two 4-story
buildings.
July 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
Neg ~ E927

719493f-b.text:
(1)
186 (left, partly shown) to 194 East Houston Street, north side, east of First Ave., as seen from Orchard Street. These houses constitute part of an entire block of such buildings which were razed to make way for the construction of the Independent System Subway (Eighth Ave. Subway). Note the market scene which is typical of this area often
referred to as the "Jewish Ghetto."
July 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A closer view of Nos. 190 and 192 East Houston Street, north side, at the foot of Orchard Street, showing the store fronts of two 4-story
buildings.
July 17, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
Neg ~ E927

719495f-a.text:
(1)
East Houston Street, north side, east from (No. 214), but not including First Ave. as seen from Ludlow Street. The block of houses, seen conspicuously, were later razed to make room for the construction
of the Independent Subway System (Eighth Ave. Subway).
July 7, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A detail of the same, showing prominently Nos. 222 to 230 East Houston Street, west of, adjoining and at the N.W. corner of Ave. "A." No. 230, the 5-story house at the corner also bears Nos. 1-3 Ave. A. Shown on the right is a clearance at the S.W. corner of Ludlow Street. These buildings were later demolished during the construction of the Independent Subway System (Eighth Ave. Subway) and today (1937) is a
playground.
March 13, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

719495f-b.text:
(1)
East Houston Street, north side, east from (No. 214), but not including First Ave. as seen from Ludlow Street. The block of houses, seen conspicuously, were later razed to make room for the construction
of the Independent Subway System (Eighth Ave. Subway).
July 7, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A detail of the same, showing prominently Nos. 222 to 230 East Houston Street, west of, adjoining and at the N.W. corner of Ave. "A." No. 230, the 5-story house at the corner also bears Nos. 1-3 Ave. A. Shown on the right is a clearance at the S.W. corner of Ludlow Street. These buildings were later demolished during the construction of the Independent Subway System (Eighth Ave. Subway) and today (1937) is a
playground.
March 13, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

719498f-a.folder: Houston Street (East) & Norfolk Street, Manhattan, NY
719498f-a.text:
East Houston Street (running from right to left), north side, west from Norfolk Street (right), to and including Ave A (where street car is seen), showing a 4-story house and its 2-story adjunct which together bear the No. 2-4 Ave A. Also shown, across the 2-story house are Nos. 244 to 248 East Houston Street, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Ave. A. The clearance seen in the foreground is on the south side of the street between Norfolk and Essex (left) Streets and was created as a result of the demolition of P.S. No. 13. (Essex Street awwhtward from East Houston Street
is actually a continuation of Ave. A).
May 8, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

721948f-a.folder: Norfolk Street & Houston Street (East), Manhattan, NY
721948f-a.text:
(1)
Norfolk Street, at, adjoining and south of the S.E. oorner of East Houston Street, as seen aoross the site of the former Public School No. 13.
May B, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(s)
The same, showing a playground occupying former excavation at
the S.W. corner.
April 3, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
The same as No. 2 and showing East Houston Street, north side, westward.
April 3, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

732820f.folder: Houston Street (East) and 1st Avenue, Manhattan, N.Y.
732820f.title: Recreation and hobbies - Bocci [game.]
